mainTask.title: HT-009: DCT Micro Apps Production Readiness Audit - Comprehensive Deep Dive Analysis
mainTask.description:
**SURGICAL DEEP DIVE AUDIT** - Comprehensive production readiness analysis for DCT Micro Apps Template-Driven Modular Factory. This task conducts an exhaustive, multi-layered inspection of every aspect of the project to create a detailed roadmap for transforming this template into a production-ready micro app delivery system.

**OBJECTIVE:** Transform the current template into a scalable, modular factory capable of delivering production-ready micro web apps within ≤7 days, with modular hot-pluggable architecture, automation-first orchestration, and commercial addon marketplace.

**KEY REQUIREMENTS FROM PRD:**
- Template-driven, modular factory for small, high-value web apps
- Production-ready micro-apps in ≤7 days (target: ≤7 days median)
- Modular architecture with discrete feature modules (hot-pluggable)
- Automation-first orchestration layer for integrations and workflows
- AI-capable modules for extraction, synthesis, and content generation
- Business-friendly delivery: single-payment builds, optional care plans
- Commercial addon marketplace (cheap → premium tiers)
- Core capabilities: tenant/user model, lightweight auth, form builder, document engine, automation connector, admin UI, audit logs
- Success metrics: ≤7 days time-to-live, ≤12 dev hours build effort, ≥98% automation reliability, ≥99.5% uptime, ≥8% lead conversion

**METHODOLOGY:** AUDIT → DECIDE → APPLY → VERIFY
**SCOPE:** Complete system analysis across 8 major domains
**ESTIMATED HOURS:** 120+ hours across 8 phases
**DELIVERABLE:** Comprehensive production readiness roadmap with surgical implementation plan

**CRITICAL SUCCESS FACTORS:**
- Modular architecture with hot-pluggable modules
- Automation orchestration layer design
- Tenant isolation and multi-tenancy
- Client onboarding and provisioning system
- Integration ecosystem and marketplace
- Security and compliance framework
- Performance and scalability optimization
- Business model and operational analysis

**STATUS:** PENDING
**PRIORITY:** CRITICAL

metadata.target_file: C:\Users\Dontae-PC\Downloads\# DCT Micro-Apps — Product Requirements Document.txt
core_capabilities: Tenant & user model (single client instance per deployment)
Form builder and persistent submission storage
Admin UI: module manager, system health, logs, analytics

module_taxonomy.core_modules: auth, forms/submissions, document/export, basic admin, automation connector
module_taxonomy.low_cost_addons: additional form templates, extra export formats, scheduler embed, extra team seats, branded copy customization
module_taxonomy.mid_tier_addons: analytics dashboard, additional integrations, role-based access expansion, recurring scheduled jobs
module_taxonomy.premium_addons: simple CRM, advanced AI extraction, multi-stage approvals, complex data migrations, custom integration adapters

deliverables: Modular architecture with hot-pluggable modules design

success_criteria.modular_architecture: Complete modular architecture design with hot-pluggable modules
success_criteria.implementation_plan: Surgical implementation plan with detailed phases
success_criteria.risk_mitigation: All risks identified and mitigation strategies defined
success_criteria.business_validation: Business model validated with realistic projections
success_criteria.resource_planning: Complete resource requirements and timeline defined

subtasks.title: HT-009.1: Technical Architecture & Modular System Analysis
subtasks.description:
**PHASE 1 - TECHNICAL ARCHITECTURE & MODULAR SYSTEM AUDIT**

Comprehensive analysis of the current technical architecture and design of modular system architecture based on PRD requirements. This phase examines every component, dependency, and architectural decision to assess production readiness for template-driven modular factory.

**SCOPE:**
- Complete codebase architecture review and modular system design
- Technology stack assessment for modular architecture
- Database schema analysis for tenant isolation and module support
- API architecture evaluation for hot-pluggable modules
- Component system analysis for modular composition
- Testing infrastructure review for module testing
- CI/CD pipeline assessment for module deployment
- Development tooling evaluation for module development

**PRD REQUIREMENTS:**
- Template-driven, modular factory for small, high-value web apps
- Modular architecture with discrete feature modules (hot-pluggable)
- Core modules: auth, forms/submissions, document/export, basic admin, automation connector
- Module taxonomy: core modules, low-cost add-ons, mid-tier add-ons, premium add-ons
- Module contract: declarative manifest, defined inputs/outputs, configuration surface, non-destructive installation
- Hot-pluggable properties: non-disruptive, declarative registration, migration-safe, isolated configuration

**DELIVERABLES:**
- Technical architecture assessment report with modular system design
- Technology stack feasibility analysis for modular architecture
- Database schema optimization recommendations for module support
- API architecture improvement plan for hot-pluggable modules
- Component system enhancement roadmap for modular composition
- Testing infrastructure gaps analysis for module testing
- CI/CD pipeline optimization plan for module deployment
- Development tooling recommendations for module development

phase_objectives: Complete codebase architecture mapping for modular system
Assess technology stack production readiness for modular architecture
Analyze database schema for module support and tenant isolation
Evaluate API architecture scalability for hot-pluggable modules
Review component system reusability for modular composition
Assess testing infrastructure coverage for module testing
Evaluate CI/CD pipeline automation for module deployment
Review development tooling efficiency for module development
key_areas: Next.js 14 App Router architecture with modular system
TypeScript implementation and type safety for modules
Supabase integration and database design for module support
Authentication and authorization systems for tenant isolation
UI component library and design system for modular composition
Testing framework (Jest, Playwright) for module testing
Build and deployment processes for module deployment
Development environment and tooling for module development

subtasks.title: HT-009.1.1: Codebase Architecture Mapping & Modular System Design
subtasks.description: Complete mapping and analysis of the current codebase architecture, including file structure, module organization, and architectural patterns. Design modular system architecture based on PRD requirements for hot-pluggable modules.

subtasks.title: HT-009.1.2: Technology Stack Assessment for Modular Architecture
subtasks.description: Comprehensive evaluation of the current technology stack (Next.js 14, TypeScript, Supabase, etc.) for production readiness and scalability in modular architecture. Assess compatibility with hot-pluggable module requirements.

subtasks.title: HT-009.1.3: Database Schema Analysis for Module Support
subtasks.description: Deep analysis of the current database schema, including tables, relationships, indexes, and optimization opportunities. Design schema modifications to support modular architecture and tenant isolation.

subtasks.title: HT-009.1.4: API Architecture Evaluation for Hot-Pluggable Modules
subtasks.description: Assessment of the current API architecture, including REST endpoints, data flow, and scalability considerations. Design API patterns for hot-pluggable module integration and declarative registration.

subtasks.title: HT-009.1.5: Component System Analysis for Modular Composition
subtasks.description: Evaluation of the UI component system, including reusability, maintainability, and design system consistency. Design component patterns for modular composition and module integration.

subtasks.title: HT-009.1.6: Testing Infrastructure Review for Module Testing
subtasks.description: Comprehensive review of the testing infrastructure, including unit tests, integration tests, and E2E testing coverage. Design testing strategies for hot-pluggable modules and module isolation.

subtasks.title: HT-009.1.7: CI/CD Pipeline Assessment for Module Deployment
subtasks.description: Analysis of the current CI/CD pipeline, including build processes, deployment automation, and quality gates. Design pipeline modifications for module deployment and hot-pluggable activation.

subtasks.title: HT-009.1.8: Development Tooling Evaluation for Module Development
subtasks.description: Assessment of development tooling, including IDE configuration, linting, formatting, and developer experience. Design tooling enhancements for module development and declarative manifest creation.

subtasks.title: HT-009.2: Automation Orchestration Layer Analysis
subtasks.description:
**PHASE 2 - AUTOMATION ORCHESTRATION LAYER ANALYSIS**

Critical analysis of automation orchestration requirements and current implementation gaps based on PRD requirements. This phase evaluates the feasibility of implementing automation-first orchestration layer for cross-system glue, scheduled tasks, and enrichment functions.

**SCOPE:**
- Current automation implementation analysis
- Orchestration layer architecture design
- Workflow engine integration requirements
- Cross-system integration patterns
- Scheduled task management
- Enrichment function capabilities
- Workflow versioning and export
- Retry and failure handling mechanisms

**PRD REQUIREMENTS:**
- Automation and external integrations as first-class but extrinsic to application core logic
- Orchestration layer as canonical place for cross-system glue, scheduled tasks, and enrichment functions
- Business-critical guarantees (ACID semantics, auth, RLS) remain in app; orchestration for eventual consistency
- Workflows must be auditable and surfaced to admin UI
- Workflows must be versioned, exportable, and stored as discrete artifacts
- Retries, exponential backoff, execution logs, and failure handlers are first-class features
- Sensitive data passing through orchestration layer must be encrypted or minimized

**DELIVERABLES:**
- Automation orchestration layer design document
- Workflow engine integration architecture
- Cross-system integration patterns specification
- Scheduled task management system design
- Enrichment function framework
- Workflow versioning and export system
- Retry and failure handling framework
- Security model for orchestration layer

phase_objectives: Setup retry and failure handling mechanisms
Design security model for orchestration layer

subtasks.title: HT-009.3: Tenant Isolation & Multi-Tenancy Analysis
subtasks.description:
**PHASE 3 - TENANT ISOLATION & MULTI-TENANCY ANALYSIS**

Critical analysis of tenant isolation requirements and multi-tenancy implementation based on PRD requirements. This phase evaluates the feasibility of implementing single client instance per deployment with proper tenant isolation.

**SCOPE:**
- Current tenant isolation analysis
- Database multi-tenancy design
- Tenant-specific configuration management
- Branding and customization systems
- Data isolation and security
- Tenant provisioning automation
- Billing and usage tracking
- Tenant-specific feature flags

**PRD REQUIREMENTS:**
- Tenant & user model (single client instance per deployment)
- Lightweight auth & access control (low friction for end users; admin accounts for management)
- Row-level access principles applied at data store: tenant isolation enforced by default
- Tenant-specific configuration management for module settings
- Branding and theme customization for white-labeling
- Data isolation and privacy controls
- Automated tenant provisioning for rapid onboarding
- Usage tracking and billing integration

**DELIVERABLES:**
- Multi-tenant architecture design document
- Database schema multi-tenancy plan
- Tenant configuration management system
- Branding customization framework
- Data isolation security model
- Automated tenant provisioning design
- Billing integration architecture
- Feature flag tenant isolation plan

subtasks.title: HT-009.4: Client Onboarding System Design
subtasks.description:
**PHASE 4 - CLIENT ONBOARDING SYSTEM ANALYSIS**

Detailed analysis of client onboarding requirements and current manual processes. This phase designs a comprehensive self-service client portal and automated onboarding workflow.

**SCOPE:**
- Current onboarding process analysis
- Client registration and verification
- Template selection and customization
- Automated provisioning workflow
- Progress tracking and status updates
- Support ticket integration
- Client communication automation
- Onboarding analytics and optimization

**DELIVERABLES:**
- Client onboarding portal design
- Registration and verification system
- Template selection interface
- Automated provisioning workflow
- Progress tracking dashboard
- Support integration system
- Communication automation framework
- Onboarding analytics dashboard

subtasks.title: HT-009.5: Integration Ecosystem Assessment
subtasks.description:
**PHASE 5 - INTEGRATION ECOSYSTEM ANALYSIS**

Comprehensive evaluation of third-party integrations required for micro app functionality. This phase assesses current integrations and designs a complete integration ecosystem for the SaaS factory.

**SCOPE:**
- Current integration analysis
- Payment processing integration (Stripe)
- Scheduling integration (Cal.com/Calendly)
- Email service integration (Resend)
- CRM integration capabilities
- Analytics integration (Google Analytics)
- Storage integration (Supabase Storage)
- Webhook system architecture

**DELIVERABLES:**
- Integration ecosystem roadmap
- Payment processing implementation plan
- Scheduling integration architecture
- Email service optimization plan
- CRM integration framework
- Analytics integration strategy
- Storage optimization plan
- Webhook system design

subtasks.title: HT-009.6: Security & Compliance Deep Dive
subtasks.description:
**PHASE 6 - SECURITY & COMPLIANCE AUDIT**

Comprehensive security and compliance analysis for production deployment. This phase evaluates current security measures and designs a complete security framework for the SaaS factory.

**SCOPE:**
- Current security implementation analysis
- Authentication and authorization security
- Data encryption and protection
- API security and rate limiting
- Input validation and sanitization
- Compliance requirements (GDPR, CCPA, HIPAA)
- Security monitoring and incident response
- Penetration testing and vulnerability assessment

**DELIVERABLES:**
- Security framework design document
- Authentication security enhancement plan
- Data encryption implementation strategy
- API security optimization plan
- Input validation framework
- Compliance implementation roadmap
- Security monitoring system
- Penetration testing plan
